item.title: Chuck add a quote by Scott Dikkers
item.description: "I respect your right to hold your religious beliefs, and if they help you, I think that's great. I would, however, like to inform you that you are a raving kook." -- Scott Dikkers

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "How hideous is the semicolon." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Charles Portis
item.description: "She gave me a pledge card, a card promising an annual gift of $5, $10, or $25 toward the support of the Unity mission. I filled it out under the hot light of the projector. The name and address spaces were much too short, unless you wrote a very fine hand or unless your name was Ed Poe and you lived at 1 Elm St." -- Charles Portis

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Charles Portis
item.description: "Do they pay you by the hour or what? Norwood said to the monocled peanut face." -- Charles Portis

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Many years later, as he faced the firing squad, Colonel Aureliano Buendía was to remember that distant afternoon when his father took him to discover ice..." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "You have wakened not out of sleep, but into a prior dream, and that dream lies within another, and so on, to infinity, which is the number of grains of sand. The path that you are to take is endless, and you will die before you have truly awakened." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Reality is not always probable, or likely." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "The original is unfaithful to the translation." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "In the critic's vocabulary, the word "precursor" is indispensable, but it should be cleansed of all connotations of polemic or rivalry. The fact is that every writer creates his own precursors. His work modifies our conception of the past, as it will modify the future." -- Essay: "Kafka and his Precursors" -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "There is no God and we are his prophets." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Flann O'Brien
item.description: "Your talk," I said, "is surely the handiwork of wisdom because not one word of it do I understand." -- Flann O'Brien

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Flann O'Brien
item.description: "The gross and net result of it is that people who spent most of their natural lives riding iron bicycles over the rocky roadsteads of this parish get their personalities mixed up with the personalities of their bicycle as a result of the interchanging of the atoms of each of them and you would be surprised at the number of people in these parts who are nearly half people and half bicycles...when a man lets things go so far that he is more than half a bicycle, you will not see him so much because he spends a lot of his time leaning with one elbow on walls or standing propped by one foot at kerbstones." -- Flann O'Brien

item.title: Chuck add a quote by John Kennedy Toole
item.description: "Stop!' I cried imploringly to my god-like mind." -- John Kennedy Toole

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Flann O'Brien
Chuck add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "People can lose their lives in libraries. They ought to be warned." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "I can't go on, I'll go on." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Joseph Roth
item.description: "That was how things were back then. Anything that grew took its time growing, and anything that perished took a long time to be forgotten. But everything that had once existed left its traces, and people lived on memories just as they now live on the ability to forget quickly and emphatically." -- Joseph Roth

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Nicholson Baker
item.description: "...no animal likes to be pecked on the anus by a duck." -- Nicholson Baker

item.title: Chuck add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "I could see that, if not actually disgruntled, he was far from being gruntled." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Chuck add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "A melancholy-looking man, he had the appearance of one who has searched for the leak in life's gas-pipe with a lighted candle." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Chuck add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "I hadn't the heart to touch my breakfast. I told Jeeves to drink it himself." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Chuck add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "I pressed down the mental accelerator. The old lemon throbbed fiercely. I got an idea." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Wodehouse
item.description: "As for Gussie Finknottle, many an experienced undertaker would have been deceived by his appearance and started embalming on sight." -- Wodehouse

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "God is silent. Now if only man would shut up." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "If Jesus came back and saw what was being done in his name, he'd never stop throwing up." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I took a speed-reading course and read <i>War and Peace</i> in twenty minutes. It involves Russia." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "More than any other time in history, mankind faces a crossroads. One path leads to despair and utter hopelessness. The other, to total extinction. Let us pray we have the wisdom to choose correctly." -- Woody Allen
